Here is what the Castle Doctrine Law provides for in Florida, which is what the other states have based theirs on: 
 
 One: It establishes, in law, the presumption that a criminal who forcibly enters or intrudes into your home or occupied vehicle is there to cause death or great bodily harm, therefore a person may use any manner of force, including deadly force, against that person.
 
 Two: It removes the "duty to retreat" if you are attacked in any place you have a right to be. You no longer have to turn your back on a criminal and try to run when attacked. Instead, you may stand your ground and fight back, meeting force with force, including deadly force, if you reasonably believe it is necessary to prevent death or great bodily harm to yourself or others. [This is an American right repeatedly recognized in Supreme Court cases.]
 
 Three: It provides that persons using force authorized by law shall not be prosecuted for using such force.
 
 It also prohibits criminals and their families from suing victims for injuring or killing the criminals who have attacked them.
 
 As for the "legal right to be there" it was ment to include public places suc as sidewalks amd parks. basically it is saying that if someone pulls a knife or gun on you in a public park, you don't have to retreat (you have a right to be there) thereby endangering yourself as you turn your back on the weapon carrying person. Instead you can, if armed and so choose, respond with force to preserve your life/property.

 Notice the "authorized by law" part. All states have a law regarding use of force and use of deadly force. In my state it says that I can use deadly force if I "fear great bodily harm or injury to myself or another". Basically the castle doctrine repeals the "duty to retreat" which can be very dangerous (i.e. person with a young child on the street confronted by someone with a knife). It does not give people the right to kill someone begging for money.

It includes anywhere that you have a legal right to be (any public property such as parks, sidewalks, roads and commertial property such as parking garages or stores). You do not know if the homeless man is armed or not and he just made a threat to kill you.

Victims of a crime should not have to fear punishment (lawsuits from the criminal or criminal's family) for protecting themselves from a criminal. I think this law would make some criminals think twice before commiting such a crime, knowing the potential victim can and will fight back without fearing prosecution.
